fields.headline: News in brief
fields.bodyText: Track record Walkers wanting to get off the beaten track should grab a copy of the new Walking Wales brochure. The guide has been re-launched by the Wales Tourist Board ahead of the Countryside and Rights of Way Act, which comes into force in May and will give walkers more access to the Welsh countryside than ever before. · Call 08701 211257 for a free copy. Cheap flights This weekend, BMI launches its latest cut-price sale with 240,000 seats up for grabs from £25. The promotion covers flights from Heathrow to 10 UK and European destinations including Manchester (£25), Dublin (£28), Paris (£29), Amsterdam (£29), Nice (£35) and Madrid (£39) - prices are one-way, incl taxes. The flights must be booked by Tuesday for travel between April 4 and 28 (excl Fridays and Sundays). · flybmi.com. A claim too far The European Commission has been accused of falsely building up travellers' hopes by saying they have more rights than the law allows. Under new rules introduced on Thursday, compensation paid to airline passengers whose flights are cancelled or overbooked has increased. But the EC website also says holiday companies are additionally obliged to help customers continue their journeys for no extra cost if flights are cancelled. Travel companies have complained, pointing out that this is not correct, and the International Federation of Tour Operators has asked the EC to amend its guidance. · europa.eu.int Beirut blow Beirut's rising popularity as an off-beat city-break destination has been hit by the latest unrest in the region following last Monday's bomb blast. Original Travel director Tom Barber said two customers had already cancelled and others were deferring their trips. "It was doing increasingly well for us, but it was always a hard sell because of people's perceptions," he said. "Now we need to see what effect this has." Italian disruption More wildcat strikes by Italian transport workers are expected, along with planned industrial action on Monday that will involve Alitalia pilots, flight attendants and Italian air traffic control workers. Alitalia flight attendants are planning further strikes on March 4, 8 and 16. And finally... Don't want to leave Fido in kennels for a week? Bring him along for the ride. Walking specialist Headwater has introduced "take your dog" tours where you can enjoy the views and meadows of France's Haut Jura region together. · from £448pp (dogs travel for £79) for eight nights' half-board, including ferry crossing. headwater.com
